page.title: 08THE GRAMPIAN HEALTH BOARD
page.content: On Tuesday 25th of June we went to the Health Board. We spoke to Mr Hoile who gave information on the hospitals at Foresterhill. The Aberdeen Royal Infirmary has 829 beds and the Children's Infirmary has 176 beds and the Maternity Hospital has 130 beds.There is a new Central Store which is computerized. It keeps medicine, blankets etc. The Medical School is on the site. It trains young doctors and nurses and there is the Pharmacy which makes the medicines. In Aberdeen there is a hyperbaric unit. It deals with North Sea divers who may get the bends. There are hospitals spread along Deeside too.It is the biggest hospital complex in Scotland.
